data: The house of Blencarrow, which, without being one of the great houses of the county, was as comfortable and handsome as a country gentleman not exactly of the highest importance could desire, stood in a pretty little park of its own, by the side of a bright little mountain river, either in Cumberland or Westmoreland or North Lancashireâ€”for the boundaries of these counties are to me somewhat confused, and I cannot aver where one ends and another begins.
